avalancheActivity.comment: Human triggered slab avalanche fell in Hrafnbjörg by Skriða, 10-12/4. Natural avalanches in SW aspects around Skjaldbreiður have fallen in the last weeks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered rather stable after freeze-thawing cycles this weekend. Cornice collapse or small avalanches are still possible high in the mountains or in gullies or depressions.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Old wind slabs are possible on firn high in mountains, especially inland, but the snow cover is mostly considered stable. A snow pit was taken in Bláfjöll (17th of April) that gave CTM#15 at 112 cm and ECTX. Despite the snowpack being mostly stable, cornice collapse is possible and potentially could initiate small slab avalanches where freeze-thaw cycles have had less effect f.x. in gullies and depressions. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls is high where snow is frozen high in the mountains.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga. Dægursveiflur í hitastigi og hlýindi í kortunum.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few sluffs occurred in the thaw on Saturday. Two avalanches occurred in Snæfjallaströnd more than a week ago.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Saturday was warm with rain. Wet avalanches could occur while the snowpack adjusts.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Saturday was warm with rain. The snowpack is most likely becoming rather homogenous after frost and thaw cycles. Some wet sluffs could occur in the fair weather in the next few days. Windslabs were present before and some layering could still be in the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar suðlægar eða breytilegar áttir næstu daga og léttskýjað. Hiti yfir frostmarki til fjalla yfir daginn en næturfrost víða.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wide slab avalanche fell in Kotafjall in Svarfaðardalur and another smaller one in Skíðadalur after this weekends warming episode. Several slabs fell in E-NE winds a week ago and a big slab avalanche fell in NW-winds on Monday in Fljót.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Persistent weak layer is possibly still present but snow melted considerably during the weekend. Layered wind slabs are in most aspects but mainly after prevailing NE winds and strong SW winds after Sunday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Prevailing NE-winds and snow accummulation built up layered wind slabs after easter and the weeks after in northerly winds. Snow melted considerably this weekend however and these wind slabs have likely dissipated widely. However, strong SW winds on Sunday could have added snow to N-aspects high in the mountains. Snow pits from the region showed weak layers in the snowpack before the thawing as a layer beneath an ice layer showed a sudden planar fracture at medium load. This weak layer could presist high in the mountains after this weekends warming episode and in areas where thawing was less intense.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga. Dægursveiflur í hitastigi og hlýindi í kortunum.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a small avalanche in Oddsskarð on Sunday. A few small avalanches occurred in the thaw on Saturday. Several loose avalanches seen by Neskaupstaður on Tuesday and Wednesday. Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after last weeks snowfall and warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Saturday was warm and a few avalanches were seen in the area. A skier triggered an avalanche in Oddsskarð on Sunday. Small avalanches could continue to occur in the sun in the next few days. A lot of snow is still in the mountains and inland, and layers could still be present.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow is still in the mountains. Saturday was warm and a few small sluffs occurred in the area. The snowpack is expected to become stronger when it starts to freeze, but some sluffs could occur in the sun in the next few days. Layered wind slabs were present and some layering could still be in the snowpack. Cornices are widely on S-W aspects. A deep persistent weak layer could still be present at high elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar breytilegar áttir næstu daga og bjart veður. Hiti yfir frostmarki til fjalla yfir daginn en næturfrost.
